result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew K Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care along with cognitive intervention and sex offender treatment. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must register with the Sex Offender Registry Program and follow all rules and regulations of same. No contact, directly or indirectly, with the victim. No contact with the victim's family without approval of the family and approval of agent. No contact, directly or indirectly, with anyone under 18 without permission of parent/guardian and agent.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Matthew K Gonzalez in court with attorney Catherine Malchow.  Defendant Matthew K Gonzalez in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   on 14CF1067 and 15CF234.

Per Atty Malchow, new factor that investigation has found that defendant did not violate the restraining order. They feel it is relevant enough to warrant sentence modification to either concurrent sentences or reduce the sentence in 14CF1067.
Per the State, this new factor is not substantial enough to warrant a sentence modification.  Requests that motion to denied.
Per Atty Malchow, this new factor is based on inaccurate information in the PSI.

BTC:  This information was available at the time of sentencing and defendant's counsel could have brought it to the court's attention, but will consider it a new factor today. 

Time taken for DA to speak to victim and her mother regarding sentencing.

Per Atty Hanson, victim indicated to her that she had not admitted that defendant had not violated the restraining order.

BTC:  Upon re-reviewing PSI, court will not modify the sentence.  Prior sentencing re-affirmed and remains consecutive.  Entitled to 2 days extra credit.  Atty Malchow to prepare the order.

Defendant Matthew K Gonzalez in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Matthew K Gonzalez in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have received and reviewed a PSI, the amended PSI, a report from Dr. Westendorf and Racine County disciplinary reports. along with victim impact statements. No additions or corrections noted by the State. Defense puts corrections on the record. In 14CF1067, the State recommends 5 yrs IC, 7 yrs ES and on 15CF234 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES - conc with 14CF1067.

BTC: 14CF1067 - Total sentence is 13 yrs WPS bifurcated as 7 yrs IC, 6 yrs ES/CFTS
         15CF234 - Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, consec to 14CF1067

BTC: The State has mets its burden and they may use the defendants statements in their case in chief. The State will draft an order to that effect.
